title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 459.4 - Testing criteria
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 459.4 - Testing criteria

State Regulations

The sound level produced by a new snowmobile manufactured
after June 1, 1975, shall not exceed 78 decibels (78dB [A]) on the A scale, measured at a distance of 50 feet to the side of such snowmobile when the
machine is run at full throttle and tested in accordance with the procedures of
the Society of Automotive Engineers recommended practice J192-a. The sound
level produced by a snowmobile manufactured after June 1, 1980, shall not
exceed 73 decibels (73dB [A]) on the A scale, measured at a distance of 50 feet
to the side of such snowmobile when the machine is run at a speed of 15 miles
per hour and tested in accordance with the Society of Automotive Engineers
recommended practice J1161. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
459.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
